page.title: 06APPLEDORE
page.content: Up to about 1880 all the streets were cobbled. The market was built in 1828. The village has lost none of its character but AApledore has never been a place just to pass through. All around are the signs of its being a seaman's village. When the old wooden saling ships were broken up, good timbers were kept for building into the houses. The little street called "Factory Opie", running down to the quay got its name from a malt factory. The population, i 1984, was 2,135. In olden days, the houses were all built along the river, but as the vullage has grown, development has spread above the river. Today the shipyard builds modern vessels in the covered yard and the population has grown as more work has become available.
